source: NY OCM Cannabis Advertising Guidelines — cannabis.ny.gov/advertising-marketing; NY Cannabis Law §128
notes: Fast-path regex rules (15 patterns). LLM fallback handles edge cases not caught here. Key gaps: required disclaimer ABSENCE is not regex-detectable — LLM handles that check.

rules.description: Medical claim: implies the product cures, treats, prevents, or heals a condition. NY OCM prohibits all unapproved therapeutic claims.
Prescription language: cannabis is not an FDA-approved prescription drug. Use of prescription framing is prohibited.
Clinical claim: implying clinical validation without approved trials is false advertising under NY OCM rules.
Medical professional endorsement: claims of doctor recommendation imply therapeutic use. Prohibited by NY OCM.
Appeal to minors: imagery or language that could attract underage individuals is prohibited under NY Cannabis Law §128.
rules.example_violation: Fun for the whole family! Gummy bears from our edibles line

rules.pattern: \b(non[- ]?addictive|not habit[- ]?forming|no addiction risk|won.{0,5}t get addicted|zero addiction|addiction[- ]?free cannabis)\b
rules.description: Addiction claim: NY OCM prohibits claiming cannabis is non-addictive or not habit-forming without clinical substantiation.

rules.pattern: \b(completely safe|totally safe|100%\s+safe|perfectly safe|entirely safe|always safe|absolutely safe)\b
rules.description: Unqualified safety claim: NY OCM requires all cannabis products to carry risk disclosures. Claiming 'completely safe' without qualification is prohibited.
rules.example_violation: Our products are completely safe for daily use

rules.description: Free cannabis giveaway: NY Cannabis Law §134 prohibits giving away free cannabis products as promotional incentives.

rules.pattern: \b(therapeutic benefit|wellness remedy|health benefit|medicinal benefit|pharmaceutical grade cannabis|medical grade cannabis|herbal medicine|natural medicine)\b
rules.description: Wellness/therapy claim: presenting cannabis as a natural medicine or wellness remedy without clinical evidence is prohibited by NY OCM.
rules.example_violation: Experience the therapeutic benefits of our tinctures

rules.pattern: \b(get (wrecked|smashed|blazed|ripped|blasted|lit af)|maximum high|strongest high|most intense buzz|extreme intoxication|get completely stoned)\b
rules.description: Glorified intoxication: NY OCM prohibits language that glorifies intoxication as the primary benefit of cannabis products.
rules.example_violation: Get completely blazed with our new batch

rules.description: Misleading substance comparison: NY OCM prohibits claiming cannabis is safer or healthier than alcohol as it implies diminished risk.
rules.example_violation: No hangover like alcohol — try our edibles instead

rules.description: Age-targeting: any mention of individuals under 21 in proximity to cannabis product descriptions violates NY §128.
rules.example_violation: Teens are asking about our gummies

rules.description: Youth-platform marketing: NY OCM prohibits cannabis advertising on platforms primarily used by individuals under 21, including TikTok and Snapchat.
rules.example_violation: Check our TikTok for the best cannabis content

rules.description: False regulatory claim: cannabis is not FDA-approved or federally legal. Making such claims is false advertising under NY General Business Law.
rules.example_violation: Our products are FDA-approved and legal everywhere

rules.description: Guaranteed effects claim: promising specific outcomes combines both a medical claim and a false guarantee. NY OCM prohibits both.
rules.example_violation: Guaranteed to relieve your anxiety in 30 minutes
